bill_title: allow a licensed distiller to sell and ship distilled spirits directly to a consumer.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to allow a licensed distiller to sell and ship distilled spirits directly to a consumer. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That a NEW SECTION be added to chapter 35-13: Both a licensed artisan distiller and a licensed distiller may each sell and ship the licensed entity's distilled spirits to any individual in this state who is twenty-one years or older. Both a licensed artisan distiller and a licensed distiller may each sell and ship the licensed entity's distilled spirits to any individual outside this state who is twenty-one years or older, in a manner consistent with the laws of the state and political subdivision of the sale and delivery. Under this section, a licensed artisan distiller or a licensed distiller may not sell and ship in excess of twenty-five thousand gallons in a calendar year and may not sell and ship in excess of two liters of distilled spirits to any one individual in a calendar year. To sell and ship under this section, the licensed artisan distiller or licensed distiller must also meet the requirements in sections 2 and 3 of this Act. Section 2. That a NEW SECTION be added to chapter 35-13: To sell and ship directly to an individual pursuant to section 1 of this Act, the licensed artisan distiller or licensed distiller must: (1) Obtain a distilled spirits direct shipper license if selling and shipping a product to an individual in South Dakota, or if selling and shipping a product from South Dakota to an individual in another state; (2) Use an approved carrier that checks identification and obtains an adult signature for each shipment of the licensee's distilled spirits; (3) Verify the age of the purchaser and the recipient of the licensee's distilled spirits; (4) Label each shipped box containing the licensee's distilled spirits with a notice stating that the box contains alcohol and that a signature of an individual twenty-one years or older is required; (5) Abide by per-person volume limits; (6) Remit all applicable sales and excise taxes to the state of South Dakota or to the destination state if shipping outside of South Dakota; and (7) File regular reports with the Department of Revenue detailing all direct-to-consumer shipments. Section 3. That a NEW SECTION be added to chapter 35-13: An applicant for an initial or renewal of the direct shipper license must: (1) File an application with the Department of Revenue on a form prescribed by the department; (2) Pay a license fee of not more than one hundred dollars; (3) Submit a copy of the applicant's current federal basic distilled spirits manufacturing permit; (4) Register each brand label offered for sale in this state, if not previously registered, and pay all applicable brand registration fees pursuant to chapter 39-13; (5) Hold a South Dakota sales and use tax license issued by the department; and (6) Be current on the remittance of all applicable state and local taxes. The department shall issue a distilled spirits direct shipper license to any applicant who meets the requirements of this Act. Section 4. That a NEW SECTION be added to chapter 35-13: Each distilled spirits direct shipper license is valid from the first day of January through the thirty-first day of December. However, the license is valid for an additional three days if a proper application for a new license is in the possession of the department before midnight on the thirty-first day of December when the license expires. The full fee shall be charged for any license for a portion of the period. Section 5. That a NEW SECTION be added to chapter 35-13: The secretary shall promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, establishing any necessary application procedures for obtaining a distilled spirits direct shipper license as allowed by this Act and establishing the fee for issuing a distilled spirits direct shipper license. The rules must also establish form requirements for filing direct shipment reports under section 2 of this Act. The direct-to-consumer shipment reports must include the volume of distilled spirits shipped directly to individuals, destination states, sales volume in dollars and the volume of taxes paid to South Dakota and other jurisdictions.
